title: Vikings' Alex Hogh Andersen's Russian dance attempt ahead of season 6
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

It’s been a long time coming but we’ve finally got a release date for Vikings season 6, and star Alex Hogh Andersen decided to celebrate the occasion by…Russian dancing?

Hey, each to their own!

The actor, who plays Ivar the Boneless in the series, posted the video on line to mark the trailer drop for the upcoming final series of the historical epic.

Alicia Agneson, who played his wife Freydis, joked underneath the clip: ‘Sums up the whole season!’

Seems that the star is a bit more light-hearted than the ruthless leader he plays (thank God!) – but Ivar is clearly going to be out for blood after the showdown that ended season five.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Last time we saw him, he went on the run from his own kingdom after the Siege of Kattegat led by his brother, Bjorn (Alexander Ludwig).

Betrayed by his wife Freydis, whom he promptly strangled to death, he was last seen on the back of a cart hiding his face with a mask to try and get to safety, abandoning his people.

Nice to know Alex is just a little more chill than his ferocious counterpart (Picture: Rex)

As a result, Bjorn took over the throne with the approval of Ubbe (Jordan Patrick Smith) and Lagertha (Katheryn Winnick).

But surely a psychopath such as Ivar isn’t going to let that lie so easily?

More: Vikings Vikings star Alexander Ludwig promises season 6 'insanity' as action-packed trailer drops When does Vikings season 6 start as seasons 1-5 are released on DVD? Travis Fimmel signs up to new horror series ahead of Vikings finale

There’s a lot to unpack in the new trailer, including how Bjorn is now ruling Kattegat with Ubbe as his right hand man.

And, as you can imagine, there’s going to be a lot of the bloodshed we’ve come to know and love from the show.

Vikings season 6 returns December 4 on History Channel in the UK.

description: Alex Hogh Andersen, who plays Ivar the Boneless on Vikings, celebrated the season 6 announcement by attempting Russian traditional dance.
